page.title: 10HOUSING
page.content: IN NUN MONKTON PARISH THERE ARE TWELVE SCATTERED FARMSTEADS AND IN THE VILLAGE EIGHTY HOUSES, THE MAJORITY PRE 1939. MANY ARE GEORGIAN BUT ALTERED AND MODERNIZED. THERE IS NO RIBBON OR ESTATE DEVELOPMENT, NEW HOUSES ARE INFILL. OF TEN COUNCIL HOUSES BUILT, FOUR HAVE BEEN SOLD TO TENANTS. IN THE HALL PRECINCTS ARE SEVERAL EXECUTIVE-TYPE RESIDENCES IN RESTORED HALL OUTBUILDINGS OCCUPIED BY OFFICES AND STAFF OF A SPIRIT AND WINE WHOLE-SALE COMPANY. IN MOOR MONKTON THERE ARE 21 PRE-1939 DWELLINGS IN THE VILLAGE STREET. MANY ARE 18TH CENTURY, SOME ARE FORMER FARM HOUSES AND 10 ARE NEWER INFILL HOUSES. THERE IS NO RIBBON OR NEW ESTATE DEVELOPMENT BUT A FEW NEW BUNGALOWS AND 6 NEW COUNCIL HOUSES BUILT IN 1949 STAND AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE VILLAGE.
